title: Praxair opens air separation plant in Jiangsu, China
text:
Praxair opens air separation plant in Jiangsu, China 7 October 2015 Print Email 
US industrial gas producer Praxair has opened an air separation plant at the Liaoning Oxiranchem facility in Yangzhou Chemical Industrial Park, China. 
The new plant has a production capacity of 600t per day and will supply on-site, high-purity oxygen and nitrogen to the Chinese company Oxiran, which produces ethylene oxide derivative (EOD) chemicals in China for bottle manufacturing and polyester fibre production industries. 
Praxair Asia president John Panikar said: "Praxair China is proud to expand upon the strong relationship we have enjoyed with Oxiran for many years. "Praxair China is proud to expand upon the strong relationship we have enjoyed with Oxiran for many years." 
"As the exclusive industrial gas supplier in the park, we look forward to supporting Oxiran's growth and leadership position in China's EOD market, while also meeting the needs of a diverse set of customers throughout the region." 
Praxair is involved in production and supply of helium, specialty gases, and high-performance surface coatings across the globe. 
In April the company secured a long-term contract to supply industrial gases to China National Offshore Oil Company (CNOOC) for its refinery and downstream chemical production. 
As part the contract, Praxair will build, own and operate two 2,400t per day air separation plants in the Huizhou Daya Bay Chemical Industrial Park in Guangdong. 
Praxair will supply oxygen and nitrogen to CNOOC for expansion of its refinery from 250,000 to 460,000 barrels of oil per day. 
Last year, the company registered $12.3bn sales. 
It serves several industrial customers including aerospace, chemicals, food and beverage, electronics, energy, healthcare, manufacturing, and primary metals. Follow Us:
